summary: Senior statistician with nine years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry in drug development (clinical trials for testing human drugs) and five years of experience in the research organization of a chemical company. A profound knowledge of and hands-on experience with advanced statistical methods used in biostatistics and chemometrics. Able to apply proper statistical methodology to address research questions. I’m used to work in international and multidisciplinary project teams. I’m able to explain statistics in a non-technical manner to non-statisticians, which enables me to effectively communicate with team members of other disciplines and help them when needed. I’m a well-organized team player who takes considered decisions, is keen to learn, and stays calm and keeps communicating in stressful situations.

profile_positions.description:
As lead statistician, I was responsible for the statistical aspects related to the clinical development and regulatory submission of two fertility drugs and one oral contraceptive. I led a group of statisticians and statistical programmers (4 to 6 persons) during the regulatory submission of one of the fertility drugs.

As clinical trial statistician, I was responsible for the statistical aspects of several phase I to IV clinical studies used for drug licensing in the therapeutic areas Women’s Health and Oncology. This included the development of statistical analysis plans, the writing of SAS analysis programs, and the analysis, interpretation and report of clinical study results.

Worked closely with data managers to clean collected data and with statistical programmers to create analysis datasets from the collected data in usable format with clear specifications for statistical analyses and regulatory submissions.

Co-author of 12 scientific publications published in peer review journals (actively provided analyses and review).

Involved in regulatory interactions with the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA).

Hands-on experience with hypothesis testing (parametric and non-parametric tests), analysis of variance (fixed and random effects models), categorical data analysis, stepwise logistic regression, survival analysis, longitudinal data analysis, meta-analysis.
profile_positions.title: Principal Statistician

company.name: NV Organon (2005-2007) and Schering-Plough Research Institute (2007-2009)

profile_positions.description:
Clinical trial statistician of phase II and III trials used for drug licensing of two fertility drugs. I was involved in the design and conduct of the trials and in the statistical analyses and report of the trial results.

Contributed as a co-author to three scientific publications published in peer review journals (actively provided analyses and review).

Received a gratuity for my contribution to the regulatory submission of one of the fertility drugs.
profile_positions.title: Statistician

profile_positions.description:
Modeling chemical data from research laboratories and (pilot) plants to improve product quality and process control. This included the design and analysis of experiments, multivariate analysis of spectroscopic data (IR, NIR, Raman spectra; SIMS and Raman images) and powder sampling.

Provided statistical support to chemical researchers and people from marketing in the different business units of Akzo Nobel.

Applied statistical methods: PCA, PLS, multiple linear regression, linear discriminant analysis, artificial neural networks, multivariate curve resolution, multivariate image analysis, 2D correlation spectroscopy.
profile_positions.title: Statistician
